review: I got the Fire TV stick today, one of the main reasons I got it was for the Display Mirroring, I have a Fire HD 7 inch 4th gen tablet. The web page at the time of ordering and this review says the following about display mirroring:"Mirror your tablet or phone on your HDTVShare whatever is on your screen—including movies, TV shows, music, and photos—from your compatible tablet or phone with everyone in your living room using display mirroring. What you see on your **Fire OS** or Android device is exactly what you’ll see on your big screen. Includes support for devices from Motorola, LG, and Google without any additional apps or software."No where does it state that it only works with the Fire Phone or the HDX line of tablets you can only use the display mirroring on the Fire TV stick. Again this was the major reason I proceeded to order the stick, if I known ahead of time that my tablet was incompatible I would of held off the order for a long while or not ordered at all.I spent 20 to 30 minutes with Amazon support being transferred to three departments, now the reps were professional and clear I do not blame them for this, nor was this their fault.In the use of the Fire TV stick is actually Good, I find it responsive and nice (better the the Roku box I have used)  But I feel the need to give it one star soley because of the misleading advertising. Second Screen does work, but there were things I wanted to use in mirroring mode that I could not use second screen for. Had screen mirroring worked as advertised for Fire OS devices this would easily be 4/5 or 5/5 for me.
